_comment: Created by ianb on 01/10/2014 11:56:41 using v2.1
title: How did NHS staff sickness rates vary by trust type?
analysis_commentary:
Absence rates by type of organisation demonstrate the same marked seasonal fluctuation as the rate at a national level. Absence rates in ambulance trust have been consistently higher than other types of trust for the past four years.

Note that Strategic Health Authorities and Primary Care Trusts ceased to exist on 31st March 2013, and that Clinical Commissioning Groups and Commissioning Support Units came into existence on 1st April 2013. There is absence data for PCTs beyond March 2013 as these organisations continued to employ staff during their phasing out period.
data_source: Health and Social Care Information Centre, NHS Sickness Absence Rates - April 2014
